title: Temperature dependence of hydrogen diffusion in reservoir rocks: implications for hydrogen geologic storage
content:
Energy Adv., 2024, 3,2051-2065
DOI: 10.1039/D4YA00233D, Paper
Open Access
Â  This article is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported Licence.
Yun Yang, Amber Zandanel, Shimin Liu, Chelsea W. Neil, Timothy C. Germann, Michael R. Gross
This study presents a comprehensive experimental dataset on the temperature-dependent diffusion of hydrogen (H2) in reservoir rocks. The results demonstrate that H2 diffuses through reservoir rocks up to 100 times faster than methane (CH4).
